intro: Onychium multisectum, commonly known as the mountain onion or alpine onion, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Onychium multisectum is adapted to cold, rocky environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of high-altitude flora.
